intro: Aeranthes pseudonida, commonly known as the false nidal orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial orchid native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, with a distinctive lip that is often marked with purple or brown. Aeranthes pseudonida is noted for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
